formattedAddress: 31 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 31 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: East Village-based restaurant  serving Japanese hot pot, sushi, ramen, and cocktails.

originalText.text: Super delicious nabe! Have been here a few times and the quality is always consistent. Between three people we shared a set for two and two extra appetizers. It was a ton of food. The nabe also came with ramen, dumplings and some delicious sauces. The dessert was also super fragrant and tasty. Highly recommend having a reservation as it can get packed! Service was attentive and fast.

text.text: Super delicious nabe! Have been here a few times and the quality is always consistent. Between three people we shared a set for two and two extra appetizers. It was a ton of food. The nabe also came with ramen, dumplings and some delicious sauces. The dessert was also super fragrant and tasty. Highly recommend having a reservation as it can get packed! Service was attentive and fast.

originalText.text:
5/5.
Absolutely no complaints.

We were seated outdoors, in a heated hut. We did the “Tasting for 2”, which was amazing for the value based on the dishes provided (Tuna carppacio, crispy pork belly, sushi roll, hot pot of your choice, noodle of your choice, almond&matcha pudding dessert).

Our waitstaff were extremely attentive. She informed us that the included sushi roll was unavailable and substituted with one equally as delicious (we got the Kimura roll). She also demonstrated how to serve the hot pot contents, as this was our first Japanese-styled hot pot. Lastly, there was a delay in dessert, and we were given the option to wait or get a minor discount on our meal (we selected the latter).

We spent close to 2 hours here. We felt catered to and never rushed. We would absolutely return.

originalText.text: First time hitting this and was surprised to see the demand for it and the need for reservations, so plan ahead. Each entree was big enough for two people. This was the most generous sashimi platter I had in a while and the side of rice was not some skimpy little bowl either. The collagen nabe for one could easily be shared with something else small perhaps. What I do want is their curry which is not available during dinner. 2024.01.13

originalText.text: The food and service here is top notch! The hotpot was so delicious ; nothing overly salty just outstanding ingredients and freshness. Two dipping sauces are given which add richness to the items. I would definitely come back. Japanese hot pot and appetizers. Offers outdoor seating in the back.

text.text: The food and service here is top notch! The hotpot was so delicious ; nothing overly salty just outstanding ingredients and freshness. Two dipping sauces are given which add richness to the items. I would definitely come back. Japanese hot pot and appetizers. Offers outdoor seating in the back.

originalText.text: I would recommend getting a reservation beforehand as there isn't much seating inside. The service was very good, the servers were friendly and very attention. We ordered a sukiyaki for three (we had four), but the meat for three is so much that, honestly, we could have fed five. The wagyu was of good quality, and they provided us fresh eggs to dip it with, giving the meat an umami richness. The soup was also very rich and savory. We added some additional sides of ramen and udon — you can add on other things to your sukiyaki. The vegetables provided were also very fresh. We had a kimura roll — which was delicious - and a california and tempura roll. The other two rolls were so-so. I'd try other things here. We also ordered some skewers: the chicken was very juicy, the chicken skin was very crispy, and the kurobata porkbelly was also fairly crispy.
